intro: Merumea plicata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Native to coastal areas of southern Africa, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime climates. The plant is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate drought conditions. Its structure and growth habit make it a distinctive feature in its native habitat.
